Description: Pottery pear-shaped juglet, imitation of the Cypriot Black-on-Red ware; short cylindrical neck with ridge, flaring to a mushroom-shaped lip; vertical handle from shoulder to neck-ridge; slightly rounded base with prominent nipple on the underside; reddish-brown clay with lustrous red slip, decorated in black paint: three sets of lines on body and two broader bands below the neck-ridge; two vertical bands on the outer surface of the handle.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
